content.description:
Brown, chandelier ice

First you'll see once entering the upper creek after the cliff band
tree at top

A very prominent tree with a cable quicklinked as a solid anchor (tat also present) on the right side of the curtain, also a tree with tat on the left side (a bit further back). Lots of options if you redirect climbing lines (potentially up to 3x each off each anchor). Quite sustained and fun climbing on any line really.

climbs.name: Physiotherapy
climbs.fa: Brandon Pullan, Will Meinen, Danny O'Farrell 07/8

content.description:
The Rehab Wall's signature route, Physiotherapy follows a line of bolts through a couple of overhangs, to a decent stance under the big roof, next to the dagger.  Pull onto the dagger and climb to a tree anchor.  This is a really fun route on good rock!

Physiotherapy is just left of center on the Rehab Wall, and will have the characteristic hanging curtain and dagger at the top.
Take about 15 draws, 4 or 5 should be full runner so you can reduce rope drag. 3-4 screws.  A couple different trees on top have slings (be sure to inspect them).

Beautiful (but a bit short) climb up a wide pillar

Just downstream from the Rehab wall, at an intersection with another stream. Climb up some mellow ice at the stream intersection to get to the base of the route
Screws to comfort, V-thread gear

Another Rehab Wall classic!  Supermodel starts off an iced up ledge, and follows a line of bolts to the first roof.  Pull through the roof and climb ice to the top.

Supermodel is the big curtain of ice to the right of Physiotherapy.  Tree anchor.
Draws (some with runners) for bolts and screws. Use the tree anchor on top (be sure to inspect it).

climbs.name: Yoga Monster
climbs.fa: Brandon Pullan, Will Meinen, Danny O'Farrell 07/8

content.description:
Scramble up the ice under the pillar then a few rock moves trending right on to an ice pillar before heading left to the anchor on the ledge.



Just to the right of Green Monster. A collection of tightly spaced bolts on the rock lead the way.

Bolts on the rock, nice bolted anchor at the top on the left.
